summary.title: Service Unavailable for Some Users
summary.summary: We are currently experiencing an issue that is causing intermittent service unavailability for a subset of our users. Our team is actively investigating the root cause and working to restore full service as quickly as possible. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

2025-12-12.kind: Known issue for the model selection feature in VS Code Gemini Code Assist
2025-12-12.content:
The VS Code Gemini Code Assist
[model selection feature](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/chat-gemini#select-model)
incorrectly appears for users of the free tier of Gemini Code Assist for
individuals.

* The feature shouldn't appear for such users and does not function for them.

summary.title: Gemini Code Assist: Model Selection Issue
summary.summary: A known issue exists in the VS Code Gemini Code Assist where the model selection feature incorrectly appears for users on the free tier. This feature is not intended for free tier users and will not function if accessed.

summary.title: Issue detected in core services
summary.summary: We are currently investigating an issue impacting several core services. This may result in intermittent disruptions for some users. We are working to resolve this as quickly as possible and will provide updates shortly.

2025-12-12.kind: Known issue for the model selection feature in VS Code Gemini Code Assist
2025-12-12.content:
The VS Code Gemini Code Assist
[model selection feature](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/chat-gemini#select-model)
incorrectly appears for users of the free tier of Gemini Code Assist for
individuals.

* The feature shouldn't appear for such users and does not function for them.

summary.title: Gemini Code Assist: Model Selection Issue
summary.summary: Users on the free tier of Gemini Code Assist for individuals may see the model selection feature, but it is not intended for them and will not function. This is a known issue that is being addressed.

2025-12-05.content:
The [outline feature](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/chat-gemini#outline) automatically
creates AI-assisted documentation by generating short, English summaries of code
blocks within the **Outline** tab of the Gemini Code Assist plugin. Outlines
help developers to achieve rapid understanding and to focus on abstraction,
without getting bogged down by syntactical details.

You can [change the settings](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/chat-gemini#outline-settings)
to disable automatic outline generation, which instead lets you generate
outlines of files manually.

![Outline in IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist.](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/images/release-notes-images/intellij-outline.png)

summary.title: AI-generated code summaries in IntelliJ
summary.summary: The Gemini Code Assist plugin in IntelliJ now automatically generates summaries of code blocks in the Outline tab. This feature helps developers quickly understand code by focusing on abstraction rather than syntax. You can also manually generate these outlines by adjusting the plugin's settings.

2025-12-05.content:
The [finish changes](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist//write-code-gemini#finish-changes)
feature acts as an AI pair programmer that observes your in-progress work and
completes the job, eliminating the need to write complex prompts. The core
strength of the finish changes feature lies in its flexibility, allowing you to
use a mix of input styles, such as pseudocode, #TODOs, or half-written code.
This combination minimizes distraction and ensures you remain in control of the
high-level design.

summary.title: Finish Changes in IntelliJ (Preview)
summary.summary: The Finish Changes feature in IntelliJ acts as an AI pair programmer to complete your work, offering flexibility with various input styles like pseudocode, #TODOs, or half-written code while keeping you in control.

2025-12-04.kind: Model selection for VS Code Gemini Code Assist
2025-12-04.content:
The following VS Code Gemini Code Assist users can now
[manually select the model](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/chat-gemini#select-model)
used by Gemini Code Assist:

* Gemini Code Assist Enterprise users
* Gemini Code Assist Standard users
* Gemini Code Assist for individuals, if you have a Google AI Pro or Ultra
  subscription

summary.title: Model Selection for VS Code Gemini Code Assist
summary.summary: Users can now manually select the model used by Gemini Code Assist in VS Code.

summary.title: New features launched!

2025-11-20.content: Various bug fixes and minor product enhancements.

summary.title: Bug Fixes in IntelliJ
summary.summary: Minor improvements and fixes for IntelliJ.

2025-11-13.kind: Known issue in VS Code 2.57 and later
2025-11-13.content:
The Gemini Code Assist 2.57 and later releases for VS Code have a known issue
that prevents the extension from connecting to the server if you are using a
gnc c runtime version that's earlier than 2.36.

* You can permanently fix this issue by upgrading your gnu c runtime version to
  2.36 or higher.
* Alternatively, you can downgrade the Gemini Code Assist VS Code extension
  to version 2.56 until a fix is released.

summary.title: Gemini Code Assist: Connection Issue in VS Code
summary.summary: A known issue in Gemini Code Assist VS Code extension versions 2.57 and later prevents connections if the gnu c runtime is earlier than 2.36. Users can either upgrade their gnu c runtime to 2.36+ or downgrade the extension to 2.56.

2025-11-13.kind: VS Code server connection issue fixed as of version 2.58.1
2025-11-13.content:
The [server connection issue](#known_issue_in_vs_code_257_and_later) affecting
Gemini Code Assist 2.57 and 2.58 releases is fixed as of version 2.58.1

summary.title: VS Code Connection Issue Fixed
summary.summary: The connection issue affecting Gemini Code Assist in recent versions has been resolved with the release of version 2.58.1.

2025-11-12.content:
Gain deeper insights into Gemini for Google Cloud's chat performance with
metrics for chat acceptance rate and lines of chat accepted, including
interactions in Agent mode and non-agentic chat. Combine these metrics with
existing code metrics to calculate total acceptance and total lines of code
accepted, providing a complete picture of Gemini's performance. For more
information, see
[View Gemini for Google Cloud logs](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/log-gemini).

summary.title: Chat Performance Metrics
summary.summary: Get detailed chat performance metrics for Gemini for Google Cloud, including acceptance rates and lines accepted for both agent and non-agentic modes. Combine with code metrics for a full performance overview.

2025-11-12.kind: Code customization available in agent mode and Gemini CLI (Preview)
2025-11-12.content:
[Code customization](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/code-customization-overview) is now
supported when using [Gemini CLI](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/gemini-cli) and
[agent mode](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/agent-mode) in Gemini Code Assist.

summary.title: Code customization in agent mode and Gemini CLI
summary.summary: Code customization is now supported when using Gemini CLI and agent mode in Gemini Code Assist.

accepted, providing a complete picture of Gemini's performance. For more

summary.title: Chat Performance Metrics

2025-11-12.kind: Code customization available in agent mode and Gemini CLI (Preview)
2025-11-12.content:
[Code customization](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/code-customization-overview) is now
supported when using [Gemini CLI](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/gemini-cli) and
[agent mode](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/agent-mode) in Gemini Code Assist.

summary.title: Code customization in agent mode and Gemini CLI
summary.summary: Code customization is now supported when using Gemini CLI and agent mode in Gemini Code Assist.

2025-11-12.kind: Inline diff is generally available (GA) for IntelliJ
2025-11-12.content:
[Inline diff](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/chat-gemini#view_code_diffs) is generally
available for IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist. With the inline diff view, chat
generated code suggestions are visually highlighted directly in your editor.
This feature can boost productivity by offering immediate visibility on
modifications, streamlining reviews and enabling precise control over
integrating new code, all without leaving your current view.

If preferred, you can also
[change the diff view settings](https://docs.cloud.google.com/gemini/docs/codeassist/chat-gemini#change_diff_view_settings)
to have a side-by-side diff window instead of the inline diff.

![Inline diff in IntelliJ Gemini Code Assist.](https://cloud.google.com/gemini/images/release-notes-images/intellij-inline-diff.gif)

summary.title: Inline diff now available for IntelliJ
summary.summary: Inline diff for Gemini Code Assist in IntelliJ is now generally available. This feature highlights code suggestions directly in your editor, improving productivity and code integration.

2025-11-10.kind: Persistent memory for Gemini Code Assist on GitHub (Preview)
2025-11-10.content:
* [Gemini Code Assist on GitHub](https://developers.google.com/gemini-code-assist/docs/review-github-code#versions)
  now supports persistent memory, which stores your previous interactions with
  Gemini Code Assist on GitHub so that it has context during your future
  interactions.
* For users of the enterprise version, persistent memory is enabled from the
  connection settings within the Google Cloud console. For users of the consumer
  version, persistent memory is enabled from the Gemini Code Assist site. For
  more information, see
  [manage configuration files across multiple repositories](https://developers.google.com/gemini-code-assist/docs/customize-gemini-behavior-github#bulk-config).

summary.title: Gemini Code Assist on GitHub Now Features Persistent Memory
summary.summary: Gemini Code Assist on GitHub has introduced persistent memory, which saves your past conversations to provide context for future interactions. This feature is available in both enterprise and consumer versions, with configuration options in the Google Cloud console or the Gemini Code Assist site, respectively.
